qas.question: Where does Egypt rank for Religious freedom according to Pew Forum?
What percentage of Egyptians polled support death penalty for those leaving Islam?
What violation could result in stoning and was supported by 82% of Egyptian responders?

context: The Pew Forum on Religion & Public Life ranks Egypt as the <a0_0>fifth worst<a0_0/> country in the world for religious freedom. The United States Commission on International Religious Freedom, a bipartisan independent agency of the US government, has placed Egypt on its watch list of countries that require close monitoring due to the nature and extent of violations of religious freedom engaged in or tolerated by the government. According to a 2010 Pew Global Attitudes survey, <a1_0>84%<a1_0/> of Egyptians polled supported the death penalty for those who leave Islam; 77% supported whippings and cutting off of hands for theft and robbery; and 82% support stoning a person who commits <a2_0>adultery<a2_0/>.
